sentences.sentence: Following is the text of UN Secretary-General António Guterres' remarks to the Shanghai Cooperation Organization on 4 July: Thank you for this opportunity to address the Shanghai Cooperation Council.
I am sending you my greetings from the Caribbean, where during the day I attended the CARICOM Summit.
Your Summit takes place amid growing global challenges and risks.
But at a time when the world needs to work together, divisions are growing, and geopolitical tensions are rising.

These differences have been aggravated by several factors: diverging approaches to global crises; contrasting views on nontraditional security threats; and, of course, all the consequences of COVID-19 and Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
But today's global challenges, from the climate crisis to growing inequality and the governance of new technology, can only be resolved through dialogue and cooperation.
Allow me to point to three areas where I believe we can and must seek and unite for solutions.
I have proposed a Climate Solidarity Pact, under which big emitters will make extra efforts to cut emissions while developed countries support emerging economies for the benefit of all.
The Acceleration Agenda I've suggested calls for developed countries to reach net-zero as close as possible to 2040, and emerging economies as close as possible to 2050.

It urges developed countries to phase out coal by 2030 and developing countries by 2040, and calls for the delivery of the $100 billion US dollars to developing countries, the doubling of adaptation finance, and the operationalization of the loss and damage fund.
Climate action is the fight of our lives, and SCO members have an important role to play.
Second, humanity is entering a new technological era - completely unprepared.
Artificial Intelligence, autonomous weapons, and bio-engineering are three areas where governance capacities are falling far behind.

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.

text: Following is the text of UN Secretary-General António Guterres’ remarks to the Shanghai Cooperation Organization on 4 July: Thank you for this opportunity to address the Shanghai Cooperation Council. I am sending you my greetings from the Caribbean, where during the day I attended the CARICOM Summit. Your Summit takes place amid growing global challenges and risks. But at a time when the world needs to work together, divisions are growing, and geopolitical tensions are rising. These differences have been aggravated by several factors: diverging approaches to global crises; contrasting views on nontraditional security threats; and, of course, all the consequences of COVID-19 and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. But today’s global challenges, from the climate crisis to growing inequality and the governance of new technology, can only be resolved through dialogue and cooperation. Allow me to point to three areas where I believe we can and must seek and unite for solutions. I have proposed a Climate Solidarity Pact, under which big emitters will make extra efforts to cut emissions while developed countries support emerging economies for the benefit of all. The Acceleration Agenda I’ve suggested calls for developed countries to reach net-zero as close as possible to 2040, and emerging economies as close as possible to 2050. It urges developed countries to phase out coal by 2030 and developing countries by 2040, and calls for the delivery of the $100 billion US dollars to developing countries, the doubling of adaptation finance, and the operationalization of the loss and damage fund. Climate action is the fight of our lives, and SCO members have an important role to play. Second, humanity is entering a new technological era – completely unprepared. Artificial Intelligence, autonomous weapons, and bio-engineering are three areas where governance capacities are falling far behind. We have therefore proposed a
